content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function `clean_column` in Julia that takes a string `col` and returns the cleaned version of it:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col) # lowercase the string
    col = replace(col, r"^\s*" => "") # remove leading whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r"\s*$" => "") # remove trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r"\s+" => "_") # replace any spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"[-]" => "_") # replace any hyphens with underscores
    return col
end
```

You can use this function as follows:
```julia
julia> col = "My Column";
julia> clean_column(col)
"my_column"
```<|im_end|>
<|endoftext|>
